gravity_system: Timber Girt, Tall Wall Framing, Stone Column Bases
key_elements: Tall Wall Framing, Stone Column Bases, Vinyl Siding, Asphalt Shingles
overall_building_description: The structural design of the building renovation project at 2208 Line 47, Gads Hill, ON, involves a comprehensive integration of timber and steel elements to achieve both aesthetic and functional objectives. The south elevation is characterized by a 'Tall Wall' framing system, which employs 2x6 studs spaced at 16 inches on center, ensuring adequate load distribution and lateral stability. The exterior finish includes Gentek vinyl siding in Mountain Moss and Dark Drift colors, providing both durability and visual appeal. The existing steel roof is retained, indicating a design decision to integrate new construction with existing structural elements, thereby optimizing resource use and minimizing waste. The wall section detail, identified as Section A-A, reveals a double sill configuration, with the first ply secured using 1/2-inch diameter lag screws embedded 3 1/2 inches into the timber at 24 inches on center, staggered, to enhance shear transfer and load path continuity. The second ply is fastened with 3 1/4-inch nailgun nails at 2 inches on center, spaced at 12 inches along the sill, ensuring robust connection and load distribution. The inclusion of a C9x13.4 steel shape within the wall section suggests a hybrid structural approach, combining timber and steel to leverage the strengths of both materials. The glazing schedule for the south elevation specifies a total glazing area of 70.80 square feet, which is 14.04% of the total wall area, adhering to the maximum allowable glazing percentage of 100%, as per spatial calculations. This indicates a careful balance between natural light provision and thermal performance. The general notes emphasize compliance with the Ontario Building Code and other applicable standards, underscoring the importance of regulatory adherence in the design and construction process. The notes also highlight the necessity for verification of all dimensions and reporting of any discrepancies to the architectural designer, ensuring precision and accuracy in execution. The project employs Gentek vinyl trim work in Iron Ore color, and asphalt shingles in dark charcoal, similar to Iron Ore color, for roofing, providing a cohesive aesthetic while ensuring weather resistance. The use of stone column bases not only enhances the structural integrity but also adds to the architectural character of the building. The design strategy reflects a commitment to integrating new construction with existing elements, optimizing material use, and ensuring compliance with relevant codes and standards. The project demonstrates a meticulous approach to structural detailing, material selection, and regulatory compliance, ensuring a successful renovation outcome.
